CatDescriptText: Mr. Jack Shenkan, TV account executive, Penn Hills and Mr. Richard Gailey, salesman, Ingram,  were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 27, 1962, pg. 12 with question: "What is the most important issue confronting Pittsburgh in 1962?" Mr. Shenkan's answer reads: "I say re-development, which includes housing."  Mr. Gailey's answer reads: "I say that we should do something about the milk condition which is a pretty loused-up service.  We should find out why people can buy milk so much cheaper in Ohio than they can in Pennsylvania."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Jack Shenkan wearing eyeglasses, necktie, and light colored coat, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Richard Gailey wearing fedora, diagonally striped necktie, and dark coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
